metadata.Title: CVE-2022-27672 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
When SMT is enabled, certain AMD processors may speculatively executeinstructions using a target from the sibling thread after an SMT modeswitch potentially resulting in information disclosure.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-27672` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-generic - 4.4.0-2.16
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-211-lowlatency - 4.4.0-2.16
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.15.0-218-generic - 4.15.0-218.229~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-218-generic - 4.15.0-218.229~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-218-lowlatency - 4.15.0-218.229~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1094-kvm - 4.4.0-1004.9
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-aws - 4.4.0-1001.10
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1161-aws - 4.15.0-1161.174~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1170-azure - 4.15.0-1170.185~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1155-gcp - 4.15.0-1155.172~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1124-oracle - 4.15.0-1124.135~16.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-2.16').
linux-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-218.229~16.04.1').
linux-kvm package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1004.9').
linux-aws package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.10').
linux-aws-hwe package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1161.174~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1170.185~16.04.1').
linux-gcp package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1155.172~16.04.1').
linux-gke: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-oracle package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1124.135~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-raspi2: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-snapdragon: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
xen package in esm-infra/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
